videos.title: Pittsburgh Gravel Route | Gravelcroft
videos.description:
On the outskirts of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania is a gravel biking paradise centered around Cross Creek County Park. The Gravelcroft Route is a 56 mile loop which climbs 5,856 ft of elevation through the history filled Appalachian plateau. Follow me as I crisscross the PA and West Virginia border on beautiful backroads.

A gravel biking alternative to Hillman State Park. I wanted to make a route that had minimum back tracking and no senseless loops upon loops. This route is less than an hour travel time by car from Pittsburgh. 

Download the gravel biking route here. 
https://ridewithgps.com/routes/52131775
https://www.strava.com/routes/3380040846007986134
https://connect.garmin.com/modern/course/364806343

Parking Location
Thompson Hill Park | Thompson Hill Rd, Avella, PA 15312

videos.title: Racing my shadow down Vulture Alley segment of the Black Creek Trail. 9-6-2021
videos.description:
Always just out of reach.
Far from a personal best, but I will keep trying.
"vulture alley" is a section that stinks - literally. It starts at Black Point Park & Marina and runs between the canal and the working end of South Miami-Dade's Mount Trashmore to SW 97th Avenue. It is part of the Black Creek Trail. I often ride it up to SW 112th Avenue - across the canal from the South Dade Government Center / Library / Cultural Center.
For the section I ride, the only conflicts with motor vehicle crossings are at 97th Ave, Old Cutler Road, SW 216th Street (a major intersection where you have to negotiate 3 directions of traffic including on / off the Florida Turnpike, and 112th Avenue. 
The Black Creek Trail actually ends at SW 184th Street just West of Zoo Miami / Larry & Penny Thompson Park. 8.7 miles from Black Point to SW 184th Street.

videos.title: Stony (Down) - Allegrippis Trails | Huntingdon, PA
videos.description:
July 9, 2022 - Stony is a trail at Raystown that runs between the Seven Points Road Trailhead and the Baker's Hollow Trailhead. It connects the Northern trail system with the Southern Trail system at Raystown. It flows well from both directions but in this video I rode it from the Baker's Hollow Trailhead (Down). This is in my opinion the most technical trail at Raystown and probably my favorite in either direction.

https://www.trailforks.com/trails/stony/
